channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox in road, 16th November
item.description:
Fox in road towards well hall roundabout
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westhorne Avenue, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping again, 16th November
item.description:
Please pick this up. It's been here for over a week. This place is turning into a rubbish dump. Fix the bins and pick the rubbish up. It's attracting rats and vermin

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cantwell Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing issue with residential bin, 16th November
item.description:
This is reported at least twice per month, with the current photo taken today. Until there is a permanent solution this bin will continue to collect fly tipped waste and impose street rubbish on Grove Lane residents. It is a waste of council resources and money to continue the band aid solution of simply clearing the waste when reported rather than attempt a permanent fix.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Grove Lane, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gang tag graffiti sprayed in white on the glass of the bus shelter, 16th November
item.description:
FATZOO905 has been sprayed in white paving onto the glass of the bus shelter - please remove it before further gang tags appear. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, London

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Dangerous potholes and trenches, 16th November
item.description:
100 m Stretch of road in front of Golden Lane Estate is highly damaged with deep potholes, trenches and major road deformations caused by buses. Very dangerous to bikes and motorbikes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Goswell Road, City of London

item.title: Large pothole entrance into Finchley Central tube station, 16th November
item.description:
All my tyres have are showing very low pressure after driving over this pothole tonight 9pm 16th November Sunday. My tyres and alloys are showing damage see pictures. Claim to follow as I need to get this checked out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chaville Way, Church End, East Finchley, London Borough of Barnet
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wooden furniture (with dangerous protruding metal screws and bolts), 16th November
item.description:
This has been here for over 6 weeks. It's on a school route with lots of footfall. The metal screws and bolts protruding from the pieces of wood pose a particular danger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 369, Stanstead Road, Honor Oak, Catford, London Borough of Lewisham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked loud music at 3am recurring isshr, 16th November
item.description:
This driver decided to parkin in the middle of the street at 3am banging loud music, honking and basically waking up all the street. Usually between 2.30/ 3am on a Sunday ( last Sunday at 3.04am). This is in Wellington Gardens and it's going on since one month. Can you help me to identify or report this car?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wellington Gardens, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Picardy Road, Belvedere too narrow for large vehicles, 16th November
item.description:
The lower part of Picardy Road, Belvedere near the B&Q and ASDA is too narrow for large vehicles to pass through, with parked vehicles on one side, and bus 401 and 469 use this road. This is dangerous and could cause blockage and traffic jam especially when large vehicles come in opposite directions trying to get through the narrow gap. Can this part of the Picardy Road have double yellow lines, traffic lights to control the flow of traffic, or relocate the bus routes?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking sign on lampost is at face height, 16th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Ridsdale Road, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley
